intro: Hieracium helianthifolium, commonly known as the sunflower leaf hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of serrated, hairy leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its flowers are yellow and resemble those of the sunflower, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium helianthifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
